intro: Carpotroche brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit, which is edible, has a unique flavor and is often used in local cuisines.
